name: places/ChIJ-zShJAxZwokRtBxtg0Se69w
adrFormatAddress: 462 1st Ave., New York, NY 10016-9196, USA

originalText.text:
Prison like conditions. Incredibly rude and uncaring staff in the inpatient psych ward, mixing dangerous schizophrenics with less serious cases. When visiting my girlfriend, they literally were on the verge of kicking me out because.... we hugged. The horror! How dare we hug!

The whole place is filthy. "Nurses" who act more like prison guards and will straight up lie to you. When I asked to speak to my gf on the phone, they first told me "we'll tell her you called" (they never once told her any of the times I called) and then told me to "call my girlfriend on the phone in her room" and literally gave me the number of a random patient somewhere else in the hospital (psych ward patients don't have phones in their rooms).

Gives psych wards a bad rap. Should be shut down immediately. Go anywhere else if you have a choice (Mount Sinai West, NYU Langone, Presbyterian, etc).

originalText.text:
I need to get basic information on a patient recently admitted, been on the phone for 16 on their line specifically to get information about patients. How in the world does it take more than 16 minutes for them to handle all the questions about current patients?

Edit: now its been 30 minutes. 30 minutes to answer a phone! This isn't Bank of America during business hours or the IRS during tax season... this is ridiculous.

originalText.text: I was in CPEP for about four days. It was the worst four days of my life. First off, they put you in a huge room which is basically the "waiting room" till theres a bed in the ward for you, in this room theres about twelve cot beds lined up in a room and the men and women are separated by a curtain which i thought was weird and unsafe. You are woken up around 8am if not earlier for breakfast then a psychiatrist will see you for about two minutes if not less. In my four days of being at CPEP I never once saw a therapist or someone I can genuinely speak to about my mental health. I was only given meds and told to stay in bed all day. Theres a small television and a chalkboard which is your only source of entertainment. Everyone in there was zombified because of the medication they give everyone. Highly don't recommend this place. Go elsewhere.

originalText.text: I would have give this department a minus star if it was available. I don’t even know where to start. The care and staff are absolutely horrible. They ignore the needs of the patients. The head of the department which I’d rather not say her name is supposedly a highly accredited doctor I disagree 100%. Her methods of determining meds are barbaric. She does not ween patients down on meds they have been taking for years. She changes the meds constantly in short periods of time. Not once has a patient advocate spoken to a patient after several phone calls. To sum this up I wouldn’t put my dog in this ward.

originalText.text: I had a horrible experience with the front desk staff. She refused to send my medical records and said that every day that I call will add on an additional day of not getting my records. I asked her to talk to a supervisor or a manager and she hung up the phone and followed by three other hangups. I have had to call and follow up multiple times just to ensure that my documents were being sent. They have not been. in the process of pursuing this with higher power.
